movies.title: Firestorm
movies.plot: A storm is heading to the city, and with it comes another occurrence so destructive, it vows to bring down everything it touches. A crew of seasoned criminals led by the notorious Nam (Hu Jun), armed with high-powered weapons, pulls off another smooth and violent armored car heist in broad daylight in a crowded street. Whoever tries to get in their way, they will show no mercy. This puts the police force to shame and humiliation. A hardboiled senior police inspector Lui (Andy Lau), hot on the trails of Nam and his tight crew, determines to put an end to this madness that causes the lives of innocent people. But he soon comes face to face with the cruel reality that the usual police tactics are too futile to send these armed thieves behind bars. Extreme crime requires extreme justice, even if it means crossing his moral line. Tou (Lam Ka Tung), an ex-con desperate to leave his criminal past behind, volunteers to be Lui's snitch in exchange for a fresh start with his girlfriend Bing (...

biography.bio: Yao studied at Beijing Dancing Academy From 1993 to 1997, graduated from Beijing film academy in 2003. She played the lead in the play "An Lian Tao Hua Yuan" as Miss Yun during the period of school and was hired by Xi'an Film Studios. She started her performing career on TV through some sitcoms, one of which, titled My Own Swordsman (2006), made her well-known around China. Then she credited herself in many films such as Two Stupid Eggs (2007), All's Well, Ends Well 2009 (2009) and Sophie's Revenge (2009) etc. Her exaggerated style in acting comedy got reviews called "female version of Stephen Chow".
biography.name: Chen Yao

biography.bio: Ka Tung Lam was born on September 21, 1967. He is an actor and producer, known for Ip Man (2008), Infernal Affairs (2002) and Mad detective (2007).
biography.name: Ka Tung Lam

biography.bio: Andy Lau Tak-wah, (born 27 September 1961) is a Hong Kong actor, singer-songwriter, presenter, and film producer. Lau has been one of Hong Kong's most commercially successful film actors since the mid-1980s, performing in more than 160 films while maintaining a successful singing career at the same time. In the 1990s, Lau was branded by the media as one of the Four Heavenly Kings of Cantopop. Lau was entered into the Guinness World Records for the "Most Awards Won by a Cantopop Male Artist". By April 2000, he had already won a total unprecedented 292 awards. In 2005, Lau was awarded "No.1 Box office Actor 1985-2005" of Hong Kong, yielding a total box office of HKD 1,733,275,816 for shooting 108 films in the past 20 years. In 2007, Lau was also awarded the "Nielsen Box Office Star of Asia" by the Nielsen Company.
biography.name: Andy Lau

biography.bio: Jun Hu was born on March 18, 1968 in Beijing, China. He is an actor and producer, known for Red Cliff (2008), Bodyguards & Assassins (2009) and Red Cliff II (2009). He has been married to Fang Lu since May 1, 1999. They have two children.
biography.name: Jun Hu

biography.bio: Ray Lui was born on December 22, 1956 in Vietnam. He is an actor and assistant director, known for Transformers: Age of Extinction (2014), Flashpoint (2007) and Le parrain de Hong Kong (1991). He has been married to Xiaojuan Yang since 2001. They have one child. He was previously married to Cally Kwong and Kathy Chow.
biography.name: Ray Lui

biography.bio: Aaron Chow was born on May 11, 1984 in Hong Kong, British Crown Colony as Chow Chi-Kwan. He is an actor, known for The White Storm: Narcotic (2013), Kill Zone 2 (2015) and Yat yuk yat sai gai: Go dang fut siu mau gam yat gei (2015).
biography.name: Aaron Chow

biography.bio: Chi-Yeung Chow is an actor, known for Nightfall (2012), Firestorm (2013) and Love in the Buff (2012).
biography.name: Chi-Yeung Chow

biography.bio: Edward Chui was born on January 27, 1983 in Hong Kong as Woei-Dong Chui. He is an actor, known for Triad (2012), Love Stalk (2016) and Firestorm (2013).
biography.name: Edward Chui

biography.bio: Shing-Ban Lam was born on September 24, 1979 in Hong Kong, British Crown Colony. He is an actor, known for Come on, Cousin (2014), S for Sex, S for Secrets (2014) and A Secret Between Us (2013). He is married to PeK-Leng Wong. They have three children.
biography.name: Shing-Ban Lam

biography.bio: Vincent Sze was born on October 24, 1974 in Hong Kong. He is known for his work on Chinese Zodiac (2012), S.P.L. (2005) and Bodyguard: A New Beginning (2008).
biography.name: Vincent Sze

biography.bio: Chi-yin Wong was born on October 20, 1967 in Hong Kong, British Crown Colony. He is an actor, known for Tactical Unit - Comrades in Arms (2009), Out of the Dark (1995) and Chao ji wu di zhui nu zai 2 zhi gou zai xiong xin (1997).
biography.name: Chi-yin Wong

biography.bio: Grace Kwan-Hing Wong is an actress, known for Firestorm (2013), Line Walker (2016) and I Love Hong Kong 2012 (2012).
biography.name: Grace Kwan-Hing Wong

biography.bio: Michael Wong has managed to become a star of Asian cinema in Hong Kong despite not even speaking a word of Chinese Cantonese, and he had no training in martial arts; in Asia, the actor known for his starring role in action film Final Option (1994) and Fei hu (1996) where he plays a cop; for First Option the actor was nominated at the Hong Kong Film Awards, the Oscar of Hong Kong cinema, and later starred in a myriad of productions and movies oriental, often unpublished in the the West such as Yeshou xingjing (1998)_, which is considered one of the most successful films of Hong Kong cinema; actor took part but also in many U.S. films such as Niki Larson (1993) starring opposite Jackie Chan,Piège à Hong Kong (1998) with 'Jean Claude Van Damme', and the film Cold War (2012), and soon we will see the actor in the italian film The Mercury Conspiracy (2013) with Luca Barbareschi.
biography.name: Michael Wong

biography.bio: Terence Yin was born on May 19, 1975 in Hong Kong. He is an actor and producer, known for Lara Croft Tomb Raider: The Cradle of Life (2003), Cold War (2012) and L'Expert de Hong Kong (2006).
biography.name: Terence Yin
